results.title: The Dam builders: beavers and man
results.creator_credit: L. Richard Ellison, National Educational Television and Time-Life Broadcast
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World We Live In”.
A comparison of the ecological changes brought about by the dam building activities of two species of mammals - humans and the beaver. It shows that all life is interdependent and points out how humans are damaging the ecological balance of nature whereas the beaver, although bringing change to its area, is not. Shows beavers in north America and engineers in Africa. Narrated by Joseph Julian.

results.title: The Dam at Nagarjunasagar
results.creator_credit: Equinox Films, Carousel Films and Gene Leashinger
results.brief_description: South of Hyderabad, India, astride the mighty Krishna river, stands the most massive masonry dam ever constructed. In an architectural feat which parallels the building of Egypt’s Pyramids, 30,000 men, women and children worked day and night for 14 years to complete it. Nagarjunasagar is three miles across, 400 feet high and forms one of the largest man-made lakes in the world.

results.title: The Dairy farm
results.brief_description: In this film we visit a mid-western American dairy farm; we watch the farmer engaged in feeding his cattle, milking the cows, preparing the milk for marketing, and such seasonal operations as cultivating, haying, and storing fodder in the silo.

results.title: The Daily Show
results.brief_description: During the time of the protests, many late night TV shows reported on the protests, including The Daily Show while Jon Stewart was host. During the segment, Samantha Bee took a humourous approach and satirised participants.

constellations_other.name: Fight for your right
constellations_other.description: Real world revolution and the fictional representations that reflect the struggle for equality in the past, present and dystopian future.

results.title: The Daily routine (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Thomas Nielson, A High, Self Production and Charles Silverman
results.brief_description: Shows how organising the routine of the day in the primary school aids teachers’ curriculum and cognitive goals, and how a consistent routine allows children to predict the sequence of events, experience different time lengths and the concepts of beginning, middle and end. The film also illustrates how activities and drama during specific times of the day reinforce cognitive goals.

results.title: The CV workout
results.brief_description: Using three case studies, this program looks at producing the best CV to attract an interview. Identifying the right sort of CV to get an interview is an important skill. The three types of CV’s, functional, chronological and targeted with emphasis on selecting the best language and layout are linked to the case studies for more relevance. Accompanied by a Discussion Guide.

results.title: The Cutting edge: Australia's Operational Deployment Force in action
results.creator_credit: Stafford Garner and Associates and Stafford Garner
results.brief_description: In October 1986, Orange land forces invaded central Queensland to sabotage Australia’s coal export industry. To counter the threat, the Townsville-based Operational Deployment Force (the cutting edge of the Australian Army) was deployed against them. For the first time, the combat capabilities of the Operational Development Force was being tested. “Jordo” (Private Paul Jordan) was part of the Force assigned to defend our local resources. The Army cameras went into battle with “Jordo” and his platoon.

results.title: The Cutting edge
results.brief_description: This program shows us the vital search for mineral deposits. We have to mine deeper, in an environment as alien and hostile as space. We are taken possibly the deepest that cameras have ever filmed - capturing a strange world of machines that mine without explosives, that process rock underground, lifting only valuable payload to the surface. Above ground is a new breed of technology, extracting every mineral particle for the least energy consumption.

results.title: The Cut of your job
results.brief_description: This film is intended to illustrate the importance of good and appropriate clothing for salesmen. The story is of an unsuccessful salesman who could not get promotion until he is taken in hand by a fellow traveller who persuades him to improve his appearance by wearing better chosen and more appropriate clothing. He is shown choosing a hat, suit and tie and the reason of his choice is explained. The result builds his self confidence and he is then successful in his work.
